content.question: The Quakers were unique among the religious groups that settled in North America during the seventeenth century because they

choices.label: defended the rights of White people to hold American Indians in slavery
founded a colony in which all inhabitants were obliged by law to subscribe to Quaker beliefs
allowed women to speak publicly in their religious meetings and to be missionaries
emphasized religious conversion through revival meetings
emphasized the distance between the human and the divine

content.answer: allowed women to speak publicly in their religious meetings and to be missionaries
